meanings.sent1: My grandfather will predecease my grandmother.
meanings.sent2: It is common for older siblings to predecease their younger siblings.
meanings.sent3: The race between the tortoise and the hare ended when the tortoise predeceased the hare.
meanings.sent4: The fading light of the sunset seemed to predecease the arrival of the night.
meanings.sent5: The falling leaves predecease the arrival of winter, signaling the change of seasons.

meanings.sent1: Her pet fish will predecease her, leaving her heartbroken.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins predeceased the modern city that now stands in its place.
meanings.sent3: The burnt-out candle seemed to predecease the birthday party, causing a moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room predeceased the news of the unexpected tragedy.
meanings.sent5: The final notes of the music seemed to predecease the end of the concert, leaving the audience in awe.
